title: Rupee hits record low on strong NDF dollar bids; RBI likely steps in - Moneycontrol
summary:
Rupee hits record low on strong NDF dollar bids; RBI likely steps in

Date: December 27, 2024 / Source: Moneycontrol

The Indian rupee has fallen to a record low, reaching 85.3950 against the dollar as strong demand in the non-deliverable forwards market persists. The Reserve Bank of India is expected to intervene to support the currency.

  • The rupee reached an all-time low of 85.3950, surpassing the previous low of 85.2825.
  • This decline is attributed to strong dollar demand and India's widening trade deficit.
  • Amit Pabari of CR Forex suggests that pressure on the rupee may continue, predicting it will trade between 85 and 85.50 in the near term.
“The pressure on the currency is likely to persist, driven by month-end dollar demand from local oil companies.”

This significant drop in the value of the rupee underscores ongoing economic challenges in India, with potential implications for both domestic and international markets.
newTitle: Rupee Hits Record Low Amid Strong Dollar Demand

UltraTech buys 8.69% stake from Star Cement promoter group for ₹851 crore - CNBCTV18
summary:
UltraTech buys 8.69% stake from Star Cement promoter group for ₹851 crore

Date: Dec 27, 2024
Source: CNBC TV18

In a notable move in the cement industry, UltraTech Cement Ltd. has acquired an 8.69% stake in Star Cement Ltd. from its promoter group for ₹851 crore.

  • UltraTech acquired the shares at ₹235 per share.
  • This stake is a non-controlling minority stake in Star Cement.
  • Star Cement, based in Meghalaya, reported a turnover of ₹2,910 crore in FY 2024.
  • UltraTech recently also acquired a 32.72% stake in India Cements, making it a subsidiary.
  • Star Cement boasts a 7.7 MTPA grinding capacity and a 26.5% market share in the north-eastern market.
  • The company is planning a ₹380 crore capex for the second half of FY 2024.
“The blocks are estimated to have geological limestone reserves of 63.9 million tonnes.”

This acquisition indicates UltraTech's ongoing strategy of consolidation in the cement sector.
newTitle: UltraTech Acquires 8.69% Stake in Star Cement for ₹851 Crore

summary:
Dixon Technologies Enters MoU with Cellecor for Refrigerator Manufacturing

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: [source]

Dixon Technologies' subsidiary, Dixon Electro Manufacturing, has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with Cellecor Gadgets to manufacture refrigerators and their components.

  • Dixon Electro Manufacturing will produce refrigerators for Cellecor, a notable name in consumer electronics.
  • This partnership aims to increase Dixon’s customer base in the refrigerator market.
  • The agreement aligns with the 'Make in India' initiative to meet the needs of local consumers.
  • Dixon also formed a joint venture with Vivo for manufacturing smartphones.
  • Dixon reported a significant rise in net profit and revenue in Q2 FY25.
“We are delighted to announce that Dixon Electro Manufacturing has entered into an MOU with Cellecor...” - Atul B. Lall, Vice Chairman & Managing Director of Dixon Technologies.

This MoU is a strategic move for Dixon Technologies, enhancing its manufacturing capabilities and market reach.
newTitle: Dixon Technologies Enters MoU with Cellecor for Refrigerator Manufacturing

title: Stocks to watch, December 27: Jubilant FoodWorks, Mamata Machinery, NHPC, Mankind Pharma, Dixon Technologies, Gensol Engineering, and more - Upstox
summary:
Stocks to watch, December 27

Date: December 27, 2023 | Source: Market News

The domestic equity market is poised for a flat opening, influenced by subdued global cues, with several key stocks expected to draw investor attention today.

  • Mamata Machinery: IPO listed today; oversubscribed 194.95 times.
  • RedTape Ltd: Declares ₹2 interim dividend and issues 3:1 bonus shares.
  • Dixon Technologies: MOU with Cellecor for refrigerator manufacturing.
  • Gensol Engineering: Awarded ₹897 crore contract from NTPC for solar projects.
  • IndusInd Bank: Plans to auction ₹1,573 crore in distressed microfinance loans.
  • Mankind Pharma: Partnership with Innovent to commercialize cancer immunotherapy drug in India.
  • NHPC: Reports ₹1,075.97 crore loss from flash flood at Teesta-V power station.
  • Power Mech: Secures ₹186 crore order for maintenance services from JPVL.
  • Jubilant FoodWorks: MoU with Coca-Cola to market beverage products.
  • Gujarat Fluorochemicals: Approves slump sale of 57 MW power plant for ₹200 crore.
  • Electrosteel Castings: Scheduled shutdown for maintenance at Srikalahasthi Unit.
  • Quess Corp: High Court quashes penalty orders from IT Department amounting to ₹180.05 crores.
  • ACME Solar Holdings: Secures ₹1,988 crore loan for hybrid renewable energy project.
  • Lemon Tree Hotels: Announces new hotel signing in Bapane, Maharashtra, expected to open in FY 2026.

Investors should keep an eye on these stocks as they could significantly influence market performance today.

title: Tata Motors shares get an upgrade after a 37% drop from their peak on better risk-reward - CNBCTV18
summary:
Tata Motors Shares Upgraded Following 37% Drop, Signal of Better Risk-Reward

Date: Dec 27, 2024 | Source: CNBC TV18

Brokerage firm DAM Capital has upgraded Tata Motors shares to "buy" after a significant decline in stock price, citing a favourable risk-reward balance amid expectations of a sector recovery.

  • DAM Capital upgraded Tata Motors from "neutral" to "buy" with a price target of ₹870, projecting an 18% upside from current levels.
  • The stock currently faces a nearly 40% drop from its recent peak of ₹1,170.
  • A recovery in the auto sector is anticipated in FY2026, supported by positive macroeconomic factors.
  • For the bearish scenario, a price target of ₹675 suggests a potential 9% further downside.
  • Among 36 analysts, 22 recommend a "buy," 9 suggest "hold," and 5 advise "sell" on the stock.
  • Tata Motors was the best Nifty 50 performer in 2023, having doubled in value over the year.
"...the brokerage does expect near-term challenges to persist for the next 1-2 quarters, with normalcy returning to the industry by mid-financial year 2026 and financial year 2027."

This upgrade from DAM Capital represents a significant investment sentiment shift for Tata Motors, positioning it as a potential recovery stock in the automotive sector.
newTitle: Tata Motors Shares Upgraded Following 37% Drop, Signal of Better Risk-Reward

title: DAM Capital Advisors IPO Listing LIVE: Shares to hit NSE, BSE today, key things to know - Upstox
summary:
DAM Capital Advisors IPO Listing LIVE: Shares to list at 38.8% premium over issue price on NSE

Date & Source: December 27, 2024

The shares of DAM Capital Advisors are set to list at a premium of 38.8%, priced at ₹393 per share on the NSE, following an oversubscription of 81.8 times.

  • The IPO is a total offer for sale (OFS) and has a price band set between ₹269 and ₹283.
  • DAM Capital is a SEBI registered merchant banker offering a diverse range of financial services including equity capital markets and structured finance advisory.
  • The company has achieved a market share of 12.1% in the IPO and QIP segment for fiscal 2024.
  • In the past three years, DAM Capital has helped clients raise over ₹25,648 crore via IPOs and ₹10,534 crore via QIPs.
  • The company derives 67% of its revenue from merchant banking and also has a broking business.
“The DAM Capital Advisors IPO listing price will be tentatively determined on December 27, 2024.”

In conclusion, the listing of DAM Capital Advisors reflects strong demand from investors, evidenced by the significant oversubscription rate.
newTitle: DAM Capital Advisors IPO Listing Shows Strong Premium on NSE

title: Mamata Machinery IPO Listing, Share Price: Shares to list on NSE and BSE today, key details - Upstox
summary:
Mamata Machinery Shares Debut with 146.91% Premium on NSE

Date: December 27, 2023 Source: UpStox

Mamata Machinery shares were listed at ₹600 on the NSE on December 27, 2023, representing a premium of 146.91% over the IPO issue price of ₹243.

  • Shares were heavily oversubscribed, with a total subscription of 194.95 times.
  • Qualified Institutional Buyers, Non-Institutional Investors, and Retail subscriptions recorded 235.88, 274.38, and 138.08 times, respectively.
  • The financial performance shows an increase in revenue from ₹192.25 crore in FY22 to ₹236.61 crore projected for FY24.
  • The net profit increased from ₹21.70 crore in FY22 to an expected ₹36.13 crore in FY24.
  • The IPO was entirely an offer for sale, with Mamata Machinery not receiving any proceeds.

The main objective of the public offer is to gain the advantages of listing shares on the stock exchanges.

The significant debut highlights investor confidence and robust interest in Mamata Machinery, known for its packaging machines.
newTitle: Mamata Machinery Shares Debut with 146.91% Premium on NSE

title: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu reignites 70-hour work week debate, asks should we work to demographic suicide? His answer is... | Company Business News - Mint
summary:
Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu reignites 70-hour work week debate, asks should we work to demographic suicide? His answer is...

Publication Date: December 27, 2024 Source: Live Mint

In a recent post, Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu revisited the contentious 70-hour work week debate, questioning its necessity for economic development and the impact of such work culture on demographics.

The rationale behind the 70 hour work week is "it is necessary for economic development". If you look at East Asia - Japan, South Korea, Taiwan and China have all developed through extreme hard work, often imposing punitive levels of work on their own people.

Key Points:

  • Vembu cites East Asian nations as examples of economic growth alongside intense work hours.
  • He raises concerns about the low birth rates resulting from stringent work cultures.
  • Two key questions are posed: Is extreme work necessary for development? Is the resultant solitary old age worth the cost?
  • Vembu believes a minority of the workforce driving hard is sufficient for development, advocating for a work-life balance.
  • He warns against replicating the steep demographic decline seen in some East Asian countries.
newTitle: Zoho CEO Sridhar Vembu Challenges the 70-Hour Work Week Debate

summary:
Reliance Industries to Trent and Asian Paints — 10 Nifty stocks that made records in 2024

This year has been eventful for the Nifty 50 index, which has seen a 9% gain overall, with some stocks achieving records for positive and negative reasons.

  • Reliance Industries sees a potential first year of negative returns since 2014, dropping by 5.5% this year.
  • Asian Paints faces its worst calendar year on record, analysts now mostly recommend sell with targets ranging from ₹2,080 to ₹3,750.
  • Trent emerges as a top performer with a significant increase in stock value for consecutive years.
  • Mahindra & Mahindra achieves its best returns since 2009, with a stock increase of 70% this year.
  • HDFC Bank continues to provide positive returns, maintaining a strong buy rating from analysts.
  • HUL and Nestle India report their worst years since 2004 and 2002 respectively.
  • IndusInd Bank shows a significant decline, with over 40% drop in stock performance.
  • Adani Ports consistently delivers positive returns, maintaining a buy consensus from analysts.
“Adani Ports has managed a positive calendar year, the fifth time in a row it has done so.”

The performance in 2024 of various Nifty stocks illustrates a mix of turnaround successes and significant downturns, indicating a complex landscape for investors.
newTitle: Reliance Industries to Trent and Asian Paints — 10 Nifty stocks that made records in 2024

title: Weak rupee to jack up key import bills - The Financial Express
summary:
Weak Rupee to Jack Up Key Import Bills

Date: October 12, 2023 | Source: Financial Express

If the rupee’s average exchange value remains low, India’s import bill could increase by $15 billion in a year. Key agricultural imports and electronic goods could be significantly affected.

  • The rupee closed at 85.26 to the dollar, marking a record low.
  • Low oil prices may offset some costs associated with energy imports despite a weakening rupee.
  • Rupee depreciation will raise costs for edible oil, pulses, and fertilizers.
  • Smartphone prices could rise due to increased import content, especially for budget models.
  • Trade officials suggest that a decline in the rupee might prevent expected reductions in the import bills for oil and edible oils.
  • The impact on coal imports may be limited due to the structure of domestic electricity generation.
“The cost of imports of oil & gas will increase with a weakening rupee.” - Girishkumar Kadam, Icra

The ongoing depreciation of the rupee poses potential challenges for India's import landscape, particularly affecting essential commodities and technology sectors.
newTitle: Weak Rupee Likely to Increase Import Costs in India

The Indian Rupee continues to face pressure, hitting a record low of 85.28 against the US dollar, raising concerns in the financial markets.

  • The Rupee has depreciated significantly due to various economic factors.
  • Experts are analyzing the implications of this decline on the economy.
  • Government interventions and monetary policy changes are being discussed as potential responses to stabilize the currency.

title: RBI policies may have contributed to economic slowdown: Finance ministry - The Times of India
summary:
RBI Policies Linked to Economic Slowdown, Says Finance Ministry

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

The Finance Ministry has stated that the policies of the Reserve Bank of India (RBI) may have contributed to the ongoing economic slowdown in the country. This assertion sheds light on the complex interplay between monetary policy and economic performance.

  • The Finance Ministry attributes the slowdown partially to RBI's monetary policies.
  • Concerns exist about how these policies impact inflation and growth.
  • The discussion includes potential changes in RBI's approach to stimulate the economy.
“Monetary policy needs to be more aligned with growth objectives,” a ministry official commented.

The Finance Ministry's evaluation highlights growing awareness of the need for coordinated policy responses to support economic revitalization.
newTitle: RBI Policies Linked to Economic Slowdown, Says Finance Ministry

title: Ahead of Market: 10 things that will decide stock market action on Friday - The Economic Times
summary:
Market Analysis: Key Factors Influencing Stock Market Action on Friday

Publication Date: December 26, 2023

Source: Economic Times

Indian benchmark indices ended flat on the monthly expiry day as a range-bound trade prevailed, influenced by weakness in FMCG and bank stocks, yet auto and pharma stocks provided some support.

  • The S&P BSE Sensex settled at 78,472.48, down by 0.39 points.
  • The Nifty closed at 23,750.20, gaining 22.55 points or 0.1%.
  • Analysts note that Nifty's sideways movement indicates investors are cautious, struggling to rise to higher levels.

newTitle: Market Analysis: Key Factors Influencing Stock Market Action on Friday

title: Is Microsoft and OpenAI's tech bromance fraying? The ChatGPT maker's GPT-4 model is "too slow and expensive" to meet Copilot 365 users' needs. - Windows Central
summary:
Is Microsoft and OpenAI's Tech Bromance Fraying?

Publication Date: Recent
Source: Windows Central

The relationship between Microsoft and OpenAI, marked by a $13 billion investment, faces challenges as Microsoft considers integrating its own AI models into Microsoft 365 Copilot, potentially moving away from OpenAI's expensive GPT-4 model.

  • Microsoft is reported to be dissatisfied with GPT-4's speed and cost, which do not meet enterprise demands.
  • The company plans to integrate non-OpenAI AI models into its services.
  • There are concerns over OpenAI meeting computing power demands, jeopardizing its goal of achieving AGI.
  • Microsoft's Copilot has been criticized for not performing adequately, with some clients finding it unreliable.
  • OpenAI’s CEO hinted at AGI being achieved sooner than expected, yet there are financial concerns about the partnership.
“The AI-powered tool doesn't work well 75% of the time.”

In conclusion, the partnership between Microsoft and OpenAI may be at a crossroads as both companies navigate their respective ambitions and capabilities in the AI domain.
newTitle: Is Microsoft and OpenAI's Tech Partnership Deteriorating?
